issues.description: Method name mismatch for the meal-cost calculation: the problem statement (UML and text) requires a static method calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int, but the provided solution implements a static method named computeMealCost(Meal): int. The template's commented Main also references computeMealCost in one place and calculateTotalPrice in another, increasing confusion about the intended API. This discrepancy can confuse students about which method name to implement and may cause automated tests or graders expecting calculateTotalPrice to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. Rename the solution's computeMealCost(Meal) method to calculateTotalPrice(Meal) (keeping it static and returning int), and update any references in Main or other files to call calculateTotalPrice. Alternatively, update the problem statement and UML to use computeMealCost consistently if that name is preferred.

issues.description: Internal inconsistency in the solution repository: the commented example in solution Main.java calls calculateTotalPrice(...) while SealSaloon.java actually provides computeMealCost(...). Even if the code is commented out, this mixed usage is confusing when students read the solution or example code and can obscure the intended API.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the example usage in solution Main.java consistent with the actual SealSaloon API. Either change the call in Main to computeMealCost(...) or rename the method in SealSaloon to calculateTotalPrice(...). Also ensure the template/example code uses the same name so students clearly see the intended method signature.

issues.description: The problem statement (class diagram and description) requires a method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int on SealSaloon, but both the provided template comments (Main.java) and the solution implementation use the name computeMealCost(Meal). This mismatch between the problem text and the code-level identifier for the same concept (calculating the total price of a meal using shared stock) can confuse students about which method to implement or call and may lead to failing tests or incorrect implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across artifacts. Either rename the method in code to match the problem statement (preferred) or update the problem text to match the code. Concretely: change the solution and template references from computeMealCost(Meal) to calculateTotalPrice(Meal) (i.e., rename public static int computeMealCost(Meal meal) to public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal) and update all callers, e.g., Main.java). Alternatively, update the problem statement/class diagram to refer to computeMealCost if that name is intended.
